
# DataSet with autogenerated name

|||
|:-|:-|
| Id | **RDL0006**
| Mnemo | DATASET_NAME_NODEFAULT
| Severity | ⚠ Warning
| Category | [Report](./Group_Report.md)
| Source code | [DatasetNameAutoGeneratedRule.cs](../../../Rules/Reports/DatasetNameAutoGeneratedRule.cs)

## Cause

This rule is triggered when a DataSet has an automatically generated name.
<p id="descr">Replace the DataSet name with a more meaningful one.</p>

## Examples

Bad

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Report MustUnderstand="df" xmlns="...">
  <DataSets>
    <DataSet Name="Dataset1">
    </DataSet>
  </DataSets>
</Report>
```

Good

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Report MustUnderstand="df" xmlns="...">
  <DataSets>
    <DataSet Name="MY_DS">
    </DataSet>
  </DataSets>
</Report>
```

## Tips

💡 A DataSet name is considered automatically generated if it matches one of the following patterns (case insensitive):

- datasetXXX
- dataset XXX
- dataset-XXX

where XXX is a sequence number.
